title: Applying the Community of Inquiry Framework for Online Instructional Design and Pre-Service Teacher Motivation Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theory and online learning environment experience
context.additional_context: Project-based learning course for pre-service teachers to enhance online instructional design competencies and boost motivation (self-efficacy, perceived usefulness). Structured around the Community of Inquiry framework (teaching presence, social presence, cognitive presence), reflecting the heightened importance of remote education post-COVID-19.

learning_goals: The three elements of the Community of Inquiry framework (teaching presence, social presence, and cognitive presence) can be applied to online instructional design.
Based on self-efficacy and perceived usefulness, motivation for designing online instruction as a pre-service teacher can be strengthened.
Peer assessment and feedback processes can be designed and implemented using LMS-based collaboration tools.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Workspace)
Community of Inquiry Framework Case Materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
